text:
Kanye West shares pro-life pic of 6-month fetus saying ‘these souls deserve to live’ after blasting Planned Parenthood – The US Sun | The US SunJump directly to the contentUS EditionUK EditionScottish SunIrish SunSearchMy AccountSign inNewsSportLifestyleTVEntertainmentMoneyTechMotorsTravelMoreMORE SECTIONSHealthRoyalsBettingSocial CasinoShoppingTopics A-ZMORE FROM THE SUNNewslettersUS JobsUS NewsWorld NewsUK NewsPoliticsNewsUS NewsWANNABE PRES Kanye West shares pro-life pic of 6-month fetus saying ‘these souls deserve to live’ after blasting Planned ParenthoodMark HodgePublished: 5:06 ET, Jul 9 2020Updated: 8:20 ET, Jul 9 2020KANYE West tweeted out a pro-life tweet claiming six-month-old fetuses have “souls” who “deserve to live” before deleting the post.The rapper, 43, announced he is running for president last week and has since revealed he is against abortion because he follows “the word of the bible.” Kanye posted the tweet about late-term abortions before deleting the postCredit: Twitter4 The rapper told Forbes that Planned Parenthood perform the work of the 'devil'Credit: AFP or licensorsWest told Forbes yesterday that reproductive health care provider Planned Parenthood is run by “white supremacists to do the Devil's work.”The father-of-four later shared a Google search screenshot on Twitter which asked the question: “What does a 6 month fetus look like?”Along with the image, Kanye tweeted: “These souls deserve to live.”The screenshot showed a graphic illustrating the growth and development during the second trimester of pregnancy.Planned Parenthood has responded by saying this is not the first time the Trump-supporting musician has caused controversy by “parroting factually incorrect, right-wing talking points on reproductive health care”.'THESE SOULS DESERVE TO LIVE'Last year, Kanye compared Plan B - a contraceptive also known as the morning after pill - to abortion, something health care officials branded a “false equivalency.”Kanye, who previously said he was running in 2024, is an outspoken supporter of the current president and spent time with Trump in the Oval Office before the 2018 midterms.The rapper set out his bizarre political agenda in an interview with Forbes - which the news outlet said took "four rambling hours."Kanye: On the moment he decided to run for president"It’s when I was being offered the Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Awards at MTV.
"I remember being at my mom’s house, my mother-in-law, because my house was being worked on, she calls me ‘son’ and I call her ‘mom,’ I was in the shower thinking, I write raps in the shower.
"It hit me to say, ‘you’re going to run for president’ and I started laughing hysterically, I was like this is the best, I'm going to go out there and they’re going to think I'm going to do these songs and do this for entertainment, how rigged awards shows are, and then say I’m president.
"And I just laughed in the shower, I don’t know for how long, but that’s the moment it hit me."
4 West has previously supported Donald TrumpCredit: AFP or licensorsArguably, his most controversial comment was on the subject of a Covid-19 vaccine - a virus he claims he suffered from in February.He said he is suspicious of vaccines calling them “the mark of the beast.”Kanye said: “It’s so many of our children that are being vaccinated and paralyzed… So when they say the way we’re going to fix Covid is with a vaccine, I’m extremely cautious."That’s the mark of the beast. They want to put chips inside of us..."Despite running as an independent, he admitted he is still admirer of the Republican insisting: "Trump is the closest president we’ve had in years to allowing God to still be part of the conversation.”He said he will be running as a candidate for the 'Birthday Party'- "because when we win, it’s everybody’s birthday” - and that his running mate is a little-known preacher from Wyoming named Michelle Tidball.MOST READ IN NEWSWAL-K ON BY Walmart shopper admits stopping for receipt checks 'depends' on single issueGET OUT Property owner rages after being forced out of $2M home over 'exploited' ruleMURDER IN THE ALPS Inside Saad al-Hilli's wife Iqbal al-Hilli was and if they had childrenFAMILY SECRET Who is Richard Spencer and what did his wife Sheree do?The rapper - who is married to reality TV star Kim Kardashian - said he is being advised by Tesla CEO Elon Musk who publicly backed the rapper's bid on Twitter.He also admitted that he has never voted in his life and is comfortable with the fact that he is more likely to take votes away from presumed Democratic candidate Joe Biden.The rapper said: "I’m not denying it, I just told you. To say that the Black vote is Democratic is a form of racism and white supremacy."Kanye West claims he’s ‘running for president’ as Mark Cuban and Elon Musk give him ‘full support’4 Kanye announced his 2020 bid on Twitter4 Elon Musk, who backed Kanye's bid, is acting as a campaign adviser, the rapper claimsCredit: Twitter/ @kanyewestGOT a story?
